intro: Scrophularia pinnatifida, commonly known as the narrow-leaved figwort, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and along riverbanks. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy and have a distinct pinnate arrangement. Its flowering period occurs in late spring to early summer, producing clusters of tubular, two-lipped flowers in shades of pink to purple. Scrophularia pinnatifida is part of the Scrophulariaceae family, known for its medicinal and ornamental value in traditional herbal practices.
